snippet: The complaint asks the International Criminal Court to investigate charges of torture, capture and disappearances of civilians in Baja California between 2006 and 2012.
abstract: Several Mexican human rights groups say that they have filed complaint with the International Criminal Court, asking it to investigate widespread abuse of thousands of civilians by army and police in their fight against organized crime.
lead_paragraph: The complaint asks the International Criminal Court to investigate charges of torture, capture and disappearances of civilians in Baja California between 2006 and 2012.

headline.main: Mexican Rights Groups File Suit for ‘Systematic and Widespread’ Abuse by Army and Police
headline.print_headline: Mexico: Human Rights Groups Seek Court Inquiry Into Soldiers and Police
